channel.title: The help sections of this site
channel.description:
I'm curious to know how many people use the help sections on these forums. I feel as if they aren't as helpful as they might seem to be. Another problem is that there are SO many topics it's really hard to find the subject you are interested in. Would it help if the help sections were divided by revision (317 or 503+)?
All input is great.

item.title: The help sections of this site
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Rix_, post:14, topic:458073”]Really? Here are a few I can think of easily: more work for the mods, multiple topics across help boards and wrongly posted topics.

I don’t think splitting the board up will solve your problem. At the end of the day, you’ll have more cluttered boards.[/quote]More work for mods? Adding an type of board/sticky is more work for mods, if more work is all that it takes, we can always recruit more staff members. Having every revision in one section is messy, and for people who like to help out and are revision specific do not like going through topics to help out.

Why are the boards as bad as they are then? There HAS to be at least one way to fix them up. Splitting them by revision is only a mere idea.

Read full topic
item.source: The help sections of this site

item.title: The help sections of this site
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Whackatre, post:17, topic:458073”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=560996.msg4095149#msg4095149 date=1346759043]

Is there a real point in separating the boards? I see nothing wrong with a universal board for all revisions and separating them out for the sake of convenience shouldn’t be reason enough in my opinion.
[/quote]Because you aren’t involved in RSPS anymore. Those sections do more harm than good. The real point is convenience for people who post topics and the first question we have to ask them “what revision, what base, what client”, can we not keep to par with the other RSPS related sites?

I am involved with RSPS, in fact I moderate a forum primarily based on RSPS everyday! Just because I don’t participate on the development side of things anymore doesn’t mean I don’t know. I still fail to see the reason why the board layout should be changed because some people are too lazy to post their source and revision. I’d personally rather somebody add 2 extra lines to their help topic and a minor edit to the thread title over 2-3 extra boards.

As for keeping to par with other websites, I don’t think that there is any standard to keep par with. Rune-Server is the same as Moparscape, even though they throw unfounded accusations at us for being “full of trolls”. If they claim that we’re bad, they must be awful.

Well, what do you expect? Rune-Server is awful.[/quote]

Rune-Server is full of corruption, someone recently got their infractions wiped so they wouldn’t be banned because they had donated over $50.

Read full topic
item.source: The help sections of this site

I am involved with RSPS, in fact I moderate a forum primarily based on RSPS everyday! Just because I don’t participate on the development side of things anymore doesn’t mean I don’t know. I still fail to see the reason why the board layout should be changed because some people are too lazy to post their source and revision. I’d personally rather somebody add 2 extra lines to their help topic and a minor edit to the thread title over 2-3 extra boards.

As for keeping to par with other websites, I don’t think that there is any standard to keep par with. Rune-Server is the same as Moparscape, even though they throw unfounded accusations at us for being “full of trolls”. If they claim that we’re bad, they must be awful.[/quote]
Well, what do you expect? Rune-Server is awful.

item.title: The help sections of this site
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:10, topic:458073”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=560996.msg4094389#msg4094389 date=1346702201]
Is there a real point in separating the boards? I see nothing wrong with a universal board for all revisions and separating them out for the sake of convenience shouldn’t be reason enough in my opinion.
[/quote]Because you aren’t involved in RSPS anymore. Those sections do more harm than good. The real point is convenience for people who post topics and the first question we have to ask them “what revision, what base, what client”, can we not keep to par with the other RSPS related sites?[/quote]

I am involved with RSPS, in fact I moderate a forum primarily based on RSPS everyday! Just because I don’t participate on the development side of things anymore doesn’t mean I don’t know. I still fail to see the reason why the board layout should be changed because some people are too lazy to post their source and revision. I’d personally rather somebody add 2 extra lines to their help topic and a minor edit to the thread title over 2-3 extra boards.

As for keeping to par with other websites, I don’t think that there is any standard to keep par with. Rune-Server is the same as Moparscape, even though they throw unfounded accusations at us for being “full of trolls”. If they claim that we’re bad, they must be awful.

Read full topic

item.title: The help sections of this site
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Rix_:

[quote author=the elve age link=topic=560996.msg4094733#msg4094733 date=1346719123]the first question we have to ask them “what revision, what base, what client”, can we not keep to par with the other RSPS related sites?

I don’t see a problem because the question gets answered. If you want Moparscape to be on par with other sites (assuming there is an existing standard lol), more boards aren’t going to help.

What are the consequences of splitting the board up? I can’t think of one.

Really? Here are a few I can think of easily: more work for the mods, multiple topics across help boards and wrongly posted topics.

I don’t think splitting the board up will solve your problem. At the end of the day, you’ll have more cluttered boards.[/quote]
You have a point, we already have an issue where people post the same topic under Client Help and Server Help…

Read full topic

the first question we have to ask them “what revision, what base, what client”, can we not keep to par with the other RSPS related sites?

the elve age:

What are the consequences of splitting the board up? I can’t think of one.

Really? Here are a few I can think of easily: more work for the mods, multiple topics across help boards and wrongly posted topics.

I don’t think splitting the board up will solve your problem. At the end of the day, you’ll have more cluttered boards.

item.title: The help sections of this site
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

the elve age:

That’s one thing that’s wrong with this community, we are evitable to change. It doesn’t matter how or why, but this community does NOT like to change. What are the consequences of splitting the board up? I can’t think of one.

People bitching about people posting the wrong revision in the wrong section

OT: People have helped me there before, I find it useful is you can at least provide info and don’t ask “hey guyz i uh need bh codes like now plz kthx oyea 100$ thru paypal to whoever gives”. The only issue is that loads of posts there are about the exact same things, and from my knowledge, there’s no way to fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: The help sections of this site
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

The help board is something I think will never change. If anything, it’s a miracle that people manage to post there. Majority of the people asking questions there seriously do not want to learn and expect to be spoonfed. They probably don’t know how the forum rules work either; if their question is not replied to and is no longer on the front page, they’ll make a new topic.

I think that the only way to change the condition of the board is to change the PEOPLE using it.

Read full topic
item.source: The help sections of this site

item.title: The help sections of this site
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Half of the topics are about simple connection issues and portforwarding. A division just for multiple revisions wold be bad; if at all, there should be a forum for people to deal with shitty questions such as portforwarding (we could also ban portforwarding questions and direct them to a search engine; that would also work.)

Read full topic

I only rarely visit the help boards, but when I do it’s just a clusterfuck.

item.description:

[quote=“RandQm, post:2, topic:458073”]I go through the help section now and then, and look into unposted topics if i can help.
A sticky with common errors would be a good thing since 70% of the posts is about the same thing,
batches that don’t work or setting up problems ect…
Though I experienced that newfags don’t read stickies or even the rules.[/quote]

i disagree
